search_parameters.q: how old was st paul when he was converted

search_information.query_displayed: how old was st paul when he was converted

related_questions.question: How old was St. Paul when he converted?
related_questions.title: AI Overview
list: Acts 7:58: In this passage, Saul is described as a "young man" holding the coats of those stoning Stephen, suggesting he was not a young child but likely in his late 20s or early 30s.

Jewish custom: In Jewish tradition, a man would be considered an adult at age 30, potentially qualifying him for leadership positions and responsibilities like overseeing the persecution of Christians, which Saul was doing.
Early 30s: Considering these factors, scholars generally place Paul's conversion in the early to mid-30s, around the same time as the events in the Book of Acts.

related_questions.question: What are the ages of the 12 apostles?
related_questions.snippet: The Ages of the Twelve If Jesus was thirty when he began his ministry and the twelve apostles tended to be younger than him, their average age would be somewhere in the twenties. It's hardly likely that Jesus was leading around teenagers—people around half his age—so the twenties are the correct time.
related_questions.title: When were the apostles born? - National Catholic Register

related_questions.question: How old was Paul when he was crucified in the Bible?
related_questions.snippet: If he had been preaching the gospel of Jesus while under house arrest, Roman soldiers would have instantly understood that Paul was a Christian and had him executed. Therefore, Paul was likely martyred in Rome between 64 and 68 CE. If he was born in about 5 CE, he would have been in his 60s.
related_questions.title: How Did Paul Die? Year, Age, & Location of the Apostle's Death

related_questions.question: Who was the youngest disciple of Jesus?
related_questions.title: AI Overview

text_blocks.snippet: The Apostle Paul's age at the time of his conversion is not explicitly stated in the Bible, but it is estimated to be in his late 20s or early 30s, according to some biblical scholars. He was likely older than 30, as he was a Pharisee and likely a leader in persecuting Christians before his conversion.
snippet_highlighted_words: estimated to be in his late 20s or early 30s

list.title: Jewish Custom:
list.snippet: In Jewish culture, a man became a religious leader, like a Pharisee, around the age of 30, according to some theological sources.

list.title: Persecution:
list.snippet: Paul was actively involved in persecuting early Christians, which suggests he was likely an adult and not a teenager.

list.title: Acts of the Apostles:
list.snippet: The Book of Acts describes Paul's conversion as happening after the death of Jesus and the persecution of Christians, placing it within a few years of Jesus's crucifixion.

list.title: Letters:
list.snippet: Paul's letters, written after his conversion, provide some insight into his age, suggesting he was likely in his late 30s or early 40s when writing them.

text_blocks.snippet: Therefore, while a precise age is unknown, Paul was likely in his late 20s or early 30s when he was converted.
